abstract.original_text: Acute respiratory tract infections (ARTIs) are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality in children worldwide, but the aetiology of many ARTIs is still unknown. In 2001, researchers in The Netherlands reported the discovery of a previously unidentified pathogen called human metapneumovirus (hMPV). Since its initial description, hMPV has been associated with ARTI in Europe (Italy,

sentences.segment_text: Acute respiratory tract infections ( ARTIs ) are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality in children worldwide ,
but the aetiology of many ARTIs is still unknown .
In 2001 , researchers in The Netherlands reported the discovery of a previously unidentified pathogen called human metapneumovirus ( hMPV ) .
